image.altText: A Sudanese family gathered at the outback search scene, with the father in the front.

props.synopsis: A large search effort for 26-year-old Gach Top has entered its fourth day, after his car was found abandoned west of Alice Springs on Tuesday.

title.children: 'Very distressful': Family of missing 26yo speak as search continues

image.altText: An Indigenous man in traditional body paint dances.

props.synopsis: From the pain of a broken political promise and one community’s desire to push forward, the Garma festival was born.

title.children: The broken promise that has loomed over 25 years of Garma

image.altText: A woman with straight purple bob hair-cut, wearing a white jacket and colourful blouse. Black vignette.

props.synopsis: Two prominent legal organisations have condemned the NT's minister for domestic violence prevention for what they have labelled a "bizarre and unwarranted attack" on the coroner.

title.children: NT's DV minister condemned for 'unwarranted attack' on the coroner

image.altText: Bald man with beard and glasses in front of black background

props.synopsis: After cycling through six chief executives in two years, NAAJA has named its new leader. In his first interview since being appointed, he shares his priorities for the legal service moving forward.

title.children: NAAJA's new boss shares vision for future after turbulent time

image.altText: A man in an NT Corrections uniform, holding a mesh spit hood.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory parliament has passed a suite of changes to the Youth Justice Act, including a proposal to reinstate the use of spit hoods on young people in youth detention centres.

title.children: Youth justice law changes pass NT parliament, reinstating spit hoods

image.altText: Workers in high-vis uniforms working on a gas pipeline upgrade, machinery can be seen moving along the red dirt.

props.synopsis: In a move to ease chronic gas shortages, the NT's only energy provider has spent millions upgrading a major pipeline to give the territory the ability to buy from Queensland.

title.children: Expert says actions by power supplier in the NT 'unfathomable to understand'

image.altText: Woman in volunteer firefighter uniform stands in front of bar at firefighting headquarters.

props.synopsis: Di Tynan is still the beating heart of her NT volunteer fire brigade, 40 years after building the station from scrap metals and rag-tag donations.

title.children: Four decades ago, Di was the first woman in a room of firefighting captains

image.altText: Three young girls, a man and a woman standing in front of the distinctive Kremlin building

props.synopsis: Some were fleeing wokeness. Others said they were sick of racism. But for Westerners seeking a better life in Russia, things can backfire — badly.

title.children: Dozens of Aussies have applied to move to Russia. But immigrating can backfire

image.altText: An AFL footballer celebrates a goal.

props.synopsis: Izak Rankine stars in the final quarter as Adelaide overcomes an early five-goal deficit to edge Hawthorn in a thriller.

title.children: Rankine and Walker's heroics help Crows claim thriller over Hawks

image.altText: South Sydney NRL coach Wayne Bennett looks sideways in the box during a game.

props.synopsis: South Sydney's Wayne Bennett is not disappointed with his side's fight in a Lang Park thrashing, reflecting on the worst injury toll in his career as the Broncos and Dolphins secure vital wins.

title.children: No 18th man sums up injury-ravaged season for Rabbitohs as Broncos, Dolphins win

image.altText: Father Chris Riley AM

props.synopsis: Founder of Youth Off The Streets, Father Chris Riley AM, dies aged 70 following a long period of ill health.

title.children: Catholic priest and youth service founder Father Chris Riley dies aged 70

image.altText: A man and a woman wearing black and white scarves speaking to the media.

props.synopsis: Two Australians on board the Freedom Flotilla vessel said they were "brutalised psychologically in every way" while being detained in Israel as they touched down in Sydney.

title.children: Australians detained by Israel say they were 'brutalised psychologically'

image.altText: The exterior of Burgertory Mentone, featuring a red sign, pictured before its opening in August 2022

props.synopsis: The beleaguered former boss of the Burgertory restaurant chain transferred ownership of a burger joint to a heroin-addicted car thief amid a sell-off of now defunct businesses, despite shutting the shopfront a month earlier.

title.children: Burger chain boss sold shop to career criminal in business sell-off

image.altText: Close up of Richard Boyle's face looking serious outdoors

props.synopsis: Australian Tax Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has argued he should be spared convictions because he was motivated by public interest, and his actions led to change within the federal agency.

title.children: Prosecutor says ATO whistleblower acted unlawfully

image.altText: A blue background with images of Anthony Albanese, the YouTube logo and downward thumbs on top

props.synopsis: The government's announcement this week that YouTube would be included in the teen social media ban is a political backflip of Olympic proportions, and its first since the election. They pulled it off with surprising grace, but no landing is perfect, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: Government backflip on YouTube social media ban is one of Olympic proportions

image.altText: A woman with pink top and denim jacket with head down as reporters point microphones towards her

props.synopsis: A Geraldton woman who secretly gave birth in her lounge room and concealed the baby in a plastic bag that was later placed in a freezer is handed a suspended prison sentence. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: 'Tragic case': Mother avoids jail over baby found in freezer

image.altText: An empty university lecture hall.

props.synopsis: The 70-year-old man is facing three charges after inappropriate images were allegedly displayed by accident during the lecture in Melbourne earlier this year.

title.children: Academic charged after child abuse material allegedly shown in lecture

image.altText: A man makes a snow angle by lying on the ground and waving his arms and legs in a blanket of hail.

props.synopsis: A massive hailstorm transforms parts of far north South Australia into a scene from a European winter, which locals say "really did feel like snow".

title.children: Outback transformed into winter wonderland by thick blanket of hail

image.altText: Kate Moloney and Jess Anstiss hold the Super Netball trophy between each other while smiling

props.synopsis: West Coast will start the Super Netball grand final as favourites but the Melbourne Vixens are battle-hardened after scrapping through to the title match.

title.children: Nothing but Vixens' best will challenge Fever in Super Netball grand final

image.altText: An aerial view showing farmland and all of the development around it with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: Wises Farm, comprising of 39 hectares in the heart of Maroochydore, sells to a privately owned development company.

title.children: Farming family rebuffs developers' offers before $93 million sale

image.altText: A man sits in a green chair

props.synopsis: Tasmanian independent MP Craig Garland has ruled out signing a confidence and supply agreement with Premier Jeremy Rockliff, saying the Marinus Link deal shows the Liberals have "learned nothing".

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals' path to government harder as Garland rules out support

image.altText: A man in a tuxedo and woman in pink dress smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Graeme Davidson, 56, was charged over the 2020 death of Jacqueline Davidson in May this year, after arriving back in Australia from Thailand.

title.children: Ex-army major made 'quip' about killing wife to friend, court hears

image.altText: A paramedic standing alongside a parked ambulance outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: A senior doctor says there is no basis to the WA government's claims a worse than average flu season is contributing to record high ambulance ramping hours.

title.children: WA sees record ambulance ramping as government defends its initiatives

image.altText: A lightning storm lights up the night sky with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A single flash of lightning stretching more than 800 kilometres across the US has set a new "megaflash" world record. Could it happen in Australia?

title.children: 800km 'megaflash' lightning strike sets new world record

image.altText: Two police officers lift police tape on the side of a hill, while they lead a dog on a leash underneath it.

props.synopsis: Several items related to the alleged murder of a Port Lincoln man have been located, a day after a civilian walking their dog found what is believed to be part of his remains.  Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Further evidence related to alleged Port Lincoln murder found

image.altText: A woman runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Through four rounds of the NRLW, the Roosters and Broncos have seemed a class above the rest, but at the competition's first ever Magic Round, the Sharks will be looking to prove the end to this season is far from inevitable.

title.children: Sharks looking for deep waters at first ever NRLW Magic Round

image.altText: A scruffy dog with wide eyes and patchy coloured fur peaks out to the camera in between a picket fence.

props.synopsis: Under proposed laws in the ACT, dog owners would need to spend at least three hours with their pooch each day. We asked experts if that really is the ideal.

title.children: Why the right attention is as important as how long you spend with your dog

image.altText: A man in a dark hoodie, glasses and face mask walks next to two men in business suits outside the court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard Sumit Satish Rastogi, an unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women, is a "monster" and a "disgusting human being" whose offending left a huge impact on his victims.

title.children: Massage therapist who abused more than 60 women hears impact on victims

image.altText: Kylie Minogue wears gold hotpants & shear top on top of a nightclub bar in 'Spinning Around' music video

props.synopsis: Wondering where your votes wound up after the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs? You'll find what you're looking for in the other big countdown: The Hottest 200 to 101.

title.children: Is this classic the 101st best Australian song of all time?

image.altText: A blue hospital building.

props.synopsis: Monash Health in Melbourne's south-east has discovered black mould in an area where cancer patients are treated.

title.children: Major Melbourne hospital discovers black mould in cancer treatment area

image.altText: Unidentified NSW Police officers in navy uniform, with Raptor badge. Arrested man at centre with face blurred

props.synopsis: A new Sydney criminal syndicate has drawn the attention of detectives over its alleged links to an ongoing underworld feud.

title.children: New Sydney criminal group 'G7' linked to shootings and home invasions

image.altText: southern brush-tail rock-wallabies

props.synopsis: There are estimated to be fewer than 60 southern brush-tailed rock-wallabies left in the wild. Now a new population of the critically endangered species is being established in the ACT.

title.children: 'Crème de la crème' of animal world arrives in Canberra by plane

image.altText: Closeup of a hand on a senior citizen's holding a colourful ball

props.synopsis: Australia faces a potential escalation in cases of modern slavery, the NSW anti-slavery commissioner warns, as sectors such as aged care become increasingly reliant on temporary migrant workers.

title.children: The anti-slavery policies in NSW that could have global consequences

image.altText: Spotted handfish held by gloved hands, gloves are blue.

props.synopsis: The handfish looked as if it had just "flopped out of the water" when it was discovered by an office worker in central Hobart.

title.children: 'This takes the cake': Endangered handfish found in Hobart CBD street

image.altText: Close up of a small marsupial mole being held in a hand.

props.synopsis: Move over, roos and emus — this National Science Week, we're looking for the most underrated Australian animal. Meet the contestants, and vote for who you think should win.

title.children: Meet the contestants for Australia's top underrated animal
